com.scg.util

Class DateRange

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.scg.util.DateRange
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    public final class DateRange
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Encapsulates a range of two dates, inclusive of the start date and end date.
    Author:
    Russ Moul
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • DateRange

        public DateRange(java.util.Date startDate,
         java.util.Date endDate)
        Construct a DateRange given two dates.
        Parameters:
        startDate - the start date for this DateRange.
        endDate - the end date for this DateRange.

      • DateRange

        public DateRange(java.lang.String start,
         java.lang.String end)
        Construct a DateRange given two date strings in the correct format.
        Parameters:
        start - String representing the start date, of the form MM/dd/yyyy.
        end - String representing the end date, of the form MM/dd/yyyy.

      • DateRange

        public DateRange(int month,
         int year)
        Construct a DateRange for the given month.
        Parameters:
        month - the month for which this DateRange should be constructed. This integer constant should be obtained from the java.util.Calendar class by month name, e.g. Calendar.JANUARY.
        year - the calendar year

      • isInRange

        public boolean isInRange(java.util.Date date)
        Returns true if the specified date is within the range start date <= date <= end date.
        Parameters:
        date - the date to check for being within this DateRange.
        Returns:
        true if the specified date is within this DateRange.
